The opposite normal direction should not be extruded. The resulting part should have the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.2143 units * Height: 0.75 units The part is now complete.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Step 1: Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. Start by drawing a line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.75, 0.0). Then, draw a line from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.75). Next, draw a line from (0.75, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.75), and finally draw a line from (0.0, 0.75) back to the starting point (0.0, 0.0). This 2D sketch defines a 75% scaled square. Step 3: Scale and transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Scale the 2D sketch to 75% and transform it into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and the translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal by a distance of 0.75 units. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with Tapered Top and Bottom Step 1: Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and translation vector [0.2812, 0.0938, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Draw the first 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Start with a line segment from (0.0, 0.0938) to (0.1875, 0.0938) followed by an arc centered at (0.0938, 0) with an endpoint at (0.0, 0.0938). The second 2D sketch is created with the same lines, but this time, we draw an arc centered at (0.0938, 0.1875) instead. This procedure creates two overlapping arcs on a square outline. Step 3: Scale and transform the 2D sketches into 3D sketches Scale both 2D sketches to 18.75% and transform them into 3D sketches using the specified coordinate system. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketches Extrude both 3D sketches along their normals separately. Use an extrusion distance of 0.0 for the first sketch and 0.9375 units for the second sketch.
